result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariel Cortes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ariel Cortes in court.  
Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Ariel Cortes. 
 Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1,  COUNT 2, COUNT 3 AND COUNT 4 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and  he/she may not vote in any election until his her civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample nd advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

case is adjourned for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services Report.
1345 First Degree Reckless Endangering Safety.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Ariel Cortes in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel request a plea and sentencing date.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-16-2022, Filed.

22RM023935  Actual Date Bond Posted with *Sheriff
5/2/2022
Court adjusts cash bail to $10,000.00 cash with all previously ordered conditions of bail to remain.

Defendant Ariel Cortes in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defense's Bail/Bond Hearing.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court adjusts cash bail to $10,000.00 cash with all previously ordered conditions of bail to remain.  Case adjourned, Br. 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ariel Cortes in court by video with Attorney Michael J Steinle who appears in person.  Defendant Ariel Cortes in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond Hearing to Branch 45.  Bail/Bond Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am. Scheduling Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, Filed.
Motion to Modify Bail. Filed.
Notice of Retainer, Filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 038829,
Payable Number: 1001374,
Receipt Number: 22RP016299,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with LAS, MNV
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ariel Cortes in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Ariel Cortes in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
